authority.name: ACCV
authority.summary: ACCV (Autoritat de Certificacio de la Comunitat Valenciana) is a CA operated by the government of the Valencia region of Spain.

audit.auditor: Seguridad y Sistemas de Informacion S.L.

certificate.name: ACCV Root CA
certificate.document: Declaracion de Practicas de Certificacion (CPS) de la ACCV, v1.7

authority.name: IdenTrust
authority.summary: IdenTrust is a for-profit corporation serving the private, commercial and government sectors.

authority.name: Trustwave
authority.summary: Trustwave is a commercial CA serving customers worldwide; it includes the former SecureTrust and XRamp CAs. At this time there are no subordinate CAs for any of these roots; instead end entity certificates are issued directly from the roots as noted below, with different classes of certificates under different certificate policies. Note that each root CA is not associated with a single CPS, rather end entity certs are associated with policies that link to the CPS that the certificate was issued under: an EV CPS, an OV CPS, etc.

certificate.name: SecureTrust CA
certificate.summary: Root CA certificate utilized for issuing SSL certificates (OV and EV) and code signing certificates.
certificate.document: SecureTrust Corporation Certificate Practice Statement for Extended Validation Certificates, Version 1.0.1
SecureTrust Corporation Certificate Practice Statement for Organizationally Validated Standard Assurance Certificates, Version 1.5.1
SecureTrust Certification Practice Statement for Code Signing Certificates, Version 1.6.0

certificate.name: Secure Global CA
certificate.summary: Root CA certificate utilized for issuing SSL certificates (OV and EV), S/MIME certificates, and (in future) code signing certificates.
certificate.document: SecureTrust Corporation Certificate Practice Statement for Extended Validation Certificates, Version 1.0.1
SecureTrust Corporation Certificate Practice Statement for Organizationally Validated Standard Assurance Certificates, Version 1.5.1
SecureTrust Certification Practice Statement for S/MIME Certificates, Version 1.6.0
SecureTrust Certification Practice Statement for Code Signing Certificates, Version 1.6.0

certificate.name: XRamp Global CA
certificate.summary: Root CA certificate utilized for issuing SSL certificates (OV and EV), S/MIME certificates, and code signing certificates.
certificate.document: SecureTrust Corporation Certificate Practice Statement for Extended Validation Certificates, Version 1.0.1
SecureTrust Corporation Certificate Practice Statement for Organizationally Validated Standard Assurance Certificates, Version 1.5.1
SecureTrust Certification Practice Statement for S/MIME Certificates, Version 1.6.0
SecureTrust Certification Practice Statement for Code Signing Certificates, Version 1.6.0
certificate.comments: Note that this root CA certificate is already included in the Mozilla list. The present request is to enable this CA certificate for EV.

authority.name: KISA
authority.summary: Korea Information Security Agency (KISA) is the Electronic Signature Authorization Management Center for South Korea. The Korean Certification Authority Central (KCAC) of KISA issues certificates to six (6) intermediate CAs ("licensed CAs" or LCAs), which then issue end entity certificates to Korean citizens, businesses, and other organizations.

audit.auditor: Ministry of Information and Communication, Republic of Korea
audit.document: Public statement by MIC re KISA/KCAC audit

certificate.name: CertRSA01
certificate.summary: Certificates are issued from this root only to KISA's 6 LCAs (Licensed CAs), not directly to end entities. Note that this root is apparently being phased out in favor of the KISA RootCA 1.
certificate.document: Web Server Security, Code-Signing, Secure E-mail Certificates Issuance Administration Guideline (English)

certificate.name: KISA RootCA 1
certificate.summary: Certificates are issued from this root only to KISA's 6 LCAs (Licensed CAs), not directly to end entities. Note that this root CA is replacing CertRSA01.
certificate.document: Web Server Security, Code-Signing, Secure E-mail Certificates Issuance Administration Guideline (English)

certificate.name: KISA RootCA 3
certificate.summary: Certificates are issued from this root only to KISA's 6 LCAs (Licensed CAs), not directly to end entities.
certificate.document: Web Server Security, Code-Signing, Secure E-mail Certificates Issuance Administration Guideline (English)

authority.name: SwissSign
authority.summary: SwissSign AG is a commercial CSP that provides certification services for individual and corporate customers. SwissSign operates the certificate authority for the Swiss Post and is mostly focused on Switzerland but Registration Services may be used internationally. The "Platinum G2" Root CA currently has 3 subordinate CAs, the "Gold G2" Root CA has 2 and the "Silver G2" Root CA has 3.

audit.document: Swiss Accreditation Service Certified Bodies List

certificate.name: SwissSign Platinum CA - G2
certificate.summary: The SwissSign Platinum CA - G2 root has three subordinate CAs. The SwissSign Qualified Platinum CA - G2 issues "qualified" certificates according to Swiss digital signature law (ZertES). The SwissSign Personal Platinum CA - G2 issues certificates for natural persons and organizations. The Swiss Post Platinum CA - G2 issues the "Postzertifikat", a product of the Swiss Post. (Note that each of the subordinate CAs has its own CP/CPS separate from the CP/CPS of the root.) The Platinum CAs require that keys be generated on Secure Signature Creation Devices (SSCDs); since such devices are not used with servers, this hierarchy is enabled for email and object signing uses only.

certificate.name: SwissSign Gold CA - G2
certificate.summary: The "Gold G2" root CA currently has two subordinate CAs: "Personal" issues certificates for natural persons and organizations, while "Server" issues certificates for systems. This root CA may also operate other customer-specific Issuing CAs if and only if they fully comply with all the stipulations of the "Gold G2" CP/CPS.

certificate.name: SwissSign Silver CA - G2
certificate.summary: The "Silver G2" root CA currently has three subordinate CAs: "Personal" issues certificates for natural persons and organizations, "Server" issues certificates for systems, and "Switch" is operated for a customer that issues certificates for the academic community

authority.name: DCSSI
authority.summary: DCSSI is a part of the French Government. It issues certificates to French Government websites which are used by the general public. Each department has a sub CA; there are at least 20 at the moment, and potentially up to 60.

audit.auditor: Secretariat Général de la Défense Nationale

certificate.name: IGC/A
certificate.comments: No CRL or OCSP. No CPS or CP.

certificate.name: IGC/A
certificate.comments: No CRL or OCSP. No CPS or CP.

authority.name: Microsec
authority.summary: Microsec Ltd. is a Hungarian certificate authority.

certificate.name: Microsec e-Szigno Root CA
certificate.document: ETSI TS 102.042, NCP and ETSI TS 102.042, LCP CP

authority.name: S-TRUST
authority.summary: Deutscher Sparkassen Verlag GmbH is the world's largest smartcard provider and the central certification service provider for all German savings banks. This CA exists to enable up to 40 million German customers (end-users) to use their banking card as a certificate based signature, encryption and authentication device.

certificate.name: S-TRUST Authentication and Encryption Root CA 2005:PN
certificate.summary: This root will provide all customers of the German Savings Bank Financial Group with client certificates for their signature-enabled debit cards (smartcards).
certificate.document: Certification Practice Statement for the S-TRUST Network

certificate.name: S-TRUST Qualified Root CA 2008-001:PN
certificate.summary: This root will provide all customers of the German Savings Bank Financial Group with client certificates for their signature-enabled debit cards (smartcards).
certificate.document: Certification Practice Statement for the S-TRUST Network

certificate.name: S-TRUST Qualified Root CA 2007-001:PN
certificate.summary: This root will provide all customers of the German Savings Bank Financial Group with client certificates for their signature-enabled debit cards (smartcards).
certificate.document: Certification Practice Statement for the S-TRUST Network

certificate.name: S-TRUST Qualified Root CA 2006-001:PN
certificate.summary: This root will provide all customers of the German Savings Bank Financial Group with client certificates for their signature-enabled debit cards (smartcards).
certificate.document: Certification Practice Statement for the S-TRUST Network

authority.name: DigiNotar
authority.summary: DigiNotar is a Dutch trusted third party, mainly operating in the Netherlands. They issue certificates based on notary verification of applicants. They service the business, government and consumer markets.

certificate.name: DigiNotar Root CA
certificate.summary: This is the top root, used only to issue CA certificates for five application-specific subordinate CAs: DigiNotar Public CA 2025 (non-qualified personal certificates), DigiNotar Qualified CA (qualified personal certificates), DigiNotar Services CA (SSL and object signing certificates), DigiNotar Extended Validation CA (EV certificates), and DigiNotar Private CA (CA certificates for organizational CAs).

authority.name: Austrian TCC
authority.summary: The Telekom-Control Commission is the Austrian supervisory authority for electronic signatures. Its responsibility includes supervision of all certification service providers established in Austria. For every CA key used by an Austrian certification service provider, the TKK issues a certificate to the certification service provider. Based on these certificates, all certificates issued by supervised Austrian certification service providers can be verified. There are five subordinate CAs, each of which issues certificates for a different purpose.

certificate.name: Telekom-Control-Kommission Top 1
certificate.summary: The TKK issues certificates to certification service providers who are supervised according to the Austrian Electronic Signatures Act. The corresponding private keys of certification service providers are used for issuing certificates to end entities (signatories).
certificate.comments: CRL doesn't work in Firefox - bug 133191.

authority.name: VeriSign
authority.summary: VeriSign is a major commercial CA with worldwide operations and customer base.

audit.document: CA-supplied auditor's letter re WebTrust EV audit

certificate.name: VeriSign Class 3 Public Primary Certification Authority - G5
certificate.summary: This CA issues a CA certificate to the subordinate CA "VeriSign Class 3 Extended Validation SSL SGC CA", which in turn issues Extended Validation certificates for SSL-enabled servers.
certificate.document: VeriSign Trust Network Certificate Policies, Version 2.5
certificate.comments: Note that for compatibility reasons VeriSign has implemented a cross-signing scheme involving this CA. In this scheme, if applications not supporting EV functionality (e.g., Firefox 2 and earlier) encounter VeriSign EV certificates then they will end up treating this CA as a subordinate CA under the existing VeriSign Class 3 Public Primary CA root.

certificate.name: VeriSign Class 3 Public Primary Certification Authority
certificate.summary: This root CA (also known as PCA3 - G1) participates in the cross-signing scheme by which EV certs issued under the VeriSign Class 3 Public Primary Certification Authority - G5 hierarchy may chain up to existing VeriSign roots.
certificate.document: VeriSign Trust Network Certificate Policies, Version 2.5
certificate.comments: This root CA certificate is already included in Mozilla; the present request is to enable this root for EV.

certificate.name: VeriSign Class 3 Public Primary Certification Authority - G2
certificate.summary: This root CA (also known as PCA3 - G2) participates in the cross-signing scheme by which EV certs issued under the VeriSign Class 3 Public Primary Certification Authority - G5 hierarchy may chain up to existing VeriSign roots.
certificate.document: VeriSign Trust Network Certificate Policies, Version 2.5
certificate.comments: This root CA certificate is already included in Mozilla; the present request is to enable this root for EV.

certificate.name: VeriSign Class 3 Public Primary Certification Authority - G3
certificate.summary: This root CA (also known as PCA3 - G3) participates in the cross-signing scheme by which EV certs issued under the VeriSign Class 3 Public Primary Certification Authority - G5 hierarchy may chain up to existing VeriSign roots.
certificate.document: VeriSign Trust Network Certificate Policies, Version 2.5
certificate.comments: This root CA certificate is already included in Mozilla; the present request is to enable this root for EV.

authority.name: WISeKey
authority.summary: WISeKey operates the CertifyID Trust Service, which supports customer-specific CAs under a CA hierarchy rooted at the WISeKey Global Root GA CA and containing Policy CAs (subordinate to the root) and Issuing CAs (subordinate to the Policy CAs). Note that all end-entity certificates are issued by the Issuing CAs under policies set by WISeKey.

audit.auditor: WTE y E. Álvarez Auditores, S.L.

certificate.name: OISTE WISeKey Global Root GA CA
certificate.summary: As noted above, the Global Root GA CA is the one and only root for the entire CertifyID system. It issues CA certificates to Policy CAs, which in turn issue CA certificates to Issuing CAs. There are three types of Policy CAs (Standard, Advanced, and Qualified) and three types of Issuing CAs corresponding to these, each issuing a different class of certificates; verification requirements for applicants vary by class.
certificate.document: WISeKey SA Advanced Services Issuing Certification Authority Certification Practice Statement, Version 1.01
Table comparing the three different classes of end-entity certificates issued by Issuing CAs.

authority.comments: Note that the CPS for the root CA addresses only procedures related to issuance of certificates for its subordinate CAs. Issues related to issuance of end entity certificates are addressed in the other two documents references, in particular the CPS for the Advanced Services Issuing CA.

authority.name: A-Trust
authority.summary: a.trust is an accredited Trust Center in Austria issuing smartcard-based qualified certificates for Austrian citizens, to be used in eGovernment, etc.

certificate.name: A-Trust-Qual-01
certificate.summary: The intermediate CAs below this CA issue only qualified smartCard-based certificates to a natural person after a face-to-face identification.

certificate.name: A-Trust-Qual-02
certificate.summary: The intermediate CAs below this CA issue qualified smartCard-based certificates to a natural person after a face-to-face identification, smartCard-based certificates to a natural person after a face-to-face identification (eg.: email), and server certificates (eg. SSL) after domain-verification.
certificate.comment: Presumably the sub-CA for which they have given a CP/CPS is only signed by one of these four...

certificate.name: A-Trust-nQual-01
certificate.summary: The intermediate CAs below this CA issue smartCard-based certificates to a natural person after a face-to-face identification (eg.: email), software certificates (pKCS#12), and server certificates (eg. SSL) after domain-verification

certificate.name: A-Trust-nQual-03
certificate.summary: The intermediate CAs below this CA issue smartCard-based certificates to a natural person after a face-to-face identification (eg.: email), software certificates (pKCS#12), and server certificates (eg. SSL) after domain-verification

authority.name: ARGE DATEN
authority.summary: ARGE DATEN, the Austrian Society for Data Protection is a non-profit non-governmental organisation. It is the Austrian market leader in issuing certificates for eBilling. It operates subordinate CAs for eBilling, SSL Server Certificates, SSL Client Certificates, and members of governmental institutions.

certificate.name: A-CERT ADVANCED
certificate.summary: This root certificate issues both end-user certificates and CA certificates. It is the current root certificate of ARGE DATEN.

certificate.name: GLOBALTRUST
certificate.summary: This root certificate will not directly issue end-user certificates. It is used to issue the subordinate CA certificates which in turn issue the end-user certificates. This certificate is the successor to the A-CERT ADVANCED root certificate.

authority.name: Trustis
authority.summary: Trustis is a commercial CA operating primarily in the UK and Europe.

authority.name: TÜRKTRUST
authority.summary: TÜRKTRUST is a Turkish CA issuing qualified certificates in Turkey.

certificate.name: TURKTRUST Certificate Services Provider Root 1
certificate.summary: Root 1 is a "legacy" root included for compatibility with previously-issued certificates. The English version of the CPS applies to both roots.

certificate.name: TURKTRUST Certificate Services Provider Root 2
certificate.summary: Root 2 is the new root that replaced Root 1; Root 2 is used for certificates currently being issued. The English version of the CPS applies to both roots.

authority.name: Entrust
authority.summary: Entrust is a commercial CA serving the global market for SSL web certificates. Entrust also issues certificates to subordiate CAs for enterprise and commercial use.

certificate.name: Entrust Root Certification Authority
certificate.summary: This root was primarily created as the trust root for Entrust EV SSL certificates.

authority.name: ComSign
authority.summary: ComSign is a commercial Israeli CA.

certificate.name: ComSign CA
certificate.summary: Used for signing subordinates for issuing digital ID's to individuals and corporations in accordance w/ the Israeli Electronic Signature Law.

certificate.name: ComSign Secured CA
certificate.summary: Used for signing subordinates for issuing digital ID's to individuals and corporations in accordance w/ the Israeli Electronic Signature Law.

data.sha1: F9 CD 0E 2C DA 76 24 C1 8F BD F0 F0 AB B6 45 B8 F7 FE D5 7A

certificate.name: ComSign Advanced Security CA
certificate.summary: Used for signing subordinates for issuing digital ID's to individuals and corporations in accordance w/ the Israeli Electronic Signature Law.

authority.name: Kamu SM
authority.summary: Kamu Sertifikasyon Merkezi is the one government CA in Turkey that has authorization to issue certificates to government entities. They are also authorised to issue to commercial companies.

authority.name: T-Systems
authority.summary: T-Systems is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Deutsche Telekom AG.

authority.name: TC TrustCenter
authority.summary: TC TrustCenter is a commercial CA based in Germany. They offer a variety of products and services including SSL Server certificates and Email certificates.

certificate.name: TC TrustCenter Class 1 CA
certificate.summary: This root is used for email and SSL client auth only.

certificate.name: TC TrustCenter Class 2 II
certificate.summary: This Root is being used to issue all types of certificate, e.g. Email Security, SSL-Client-Authentication, SSL-Server, CodeSigning.

certificate.summary: This Root is being used to issue all types of certificate, e.g. Email Security, SSL-Client-Authentication, SSL-Server, CodeSigning.

certificate.summary: This Root is being used to issue all types of certificate, e.g. Email Security, SSL-Client-Authentication, SSL-Server, CodeSigning.

certificate.summary: This Root is being used to issue all types of certificate, e.g. Email Security, SSL-Client-Authentication, SSL-Server, CodeSigning.

certificate.summary: This Root is being used to issue all types of certificate, e.g. Email Security, SSL-Client-Authentication, SSL-Server, CodeSigning.

authority.name: SECOM Trust
authority.summary: SECOM Trust Services Co., Ltd are a commercial CA based in Japan.

audit.document: Report of Independent Certified Public Accountant

certificate.name: Security Communication EV RootCA1

Security Communication EV RootCA1 Subordinate CA Certificate Policy, Version 1.00 (Japanese)

authority.name: QuoVadis
authority.summary: QuoVadis is a commercial CA, based in Bermuda and operating globally. QuoVadis is a Qualified Certification Services Provider in Switzerland.

audit.auditor: Ernst & Young (Technology and Security Risk Services)

audit.document: CA-supplied auditor's letter re WebTrust EV audit

certificate.name: QuoVadis Root CA 2
certificate.summary: This root will be used for SSL/device certificates, including standard "organisation validated" certificates as well as EV certificates. The associated EV policy OID is 1.3.6.1.4.1.8024.0.2.100.1.2.
certificate.comments: Note that this root CA certificate is already included in the Mozilla list (per bug 365281). The present request is to enable this CA certificate for EV.

authority.name: DigiCert
authority.summary: DigiCert is a US-based commercial CA with headquarters in Lindon, UT. DigiCert provides digital certification and identity assurance services internationally to a variety of sectors including business, education, and government.

audit.document: Report in relation to the WebTrust for Certification Authorities Extended Validation Criteria

certificate.name: DigiCert High Assurance EV Root CA
certificate.document: DigiCert Certificate Policy and Certification Practice Statement (CP and CPS for OV), v3.0.6
DigiCert Certification Practice Statement for Extended Validation Certificates (CPS for EV), v1.0.1
certificate.comments: Note that this root CA certificate is already included in the Mozilla list. The present request is to enable this CA certificate for EV.

authority.name: Comodo
authority.summary: Comodo CA Ltd is a commercial CA based in the UK and serving customers worldwide. Comodo has eleven root CA certs already included in Mozilla, all of which it would like upgraded for EV use, and one additional EV root requested for inclusion. There are altogether 124 subordinate CAs signed by the root CAs listed below. Some of them exist to differentiate between different Comodo brands or products and some are used to re-brand products for its partners. In each case Comodo retains the private key for the subordinate CA within its infrastructure.

audit.document: Report in relation to the WebTrust for Certification Authorities Extended Validation Criteria

certificate.name: AddTrust Class 1 CA Root
certificate.summary: Root CA certificate with subordinate CAs issuing SSL certificates (DV, OV and EV), email certificates, and code signing certificates.
certificate.comments: Note that this root CA certificate is already included in the Mozilla list. The present request is to enable this CA certificate for EV and code signing.

certificate.summary: Root CA certificate with subordinate CAs issuing SSL certificates, email certificates, and code signing certificates.
certificate.document: Comodo Extended Validation (EV) Certification Practice Statement, Version 1.03
certificate.comments: This is a new root CA certificate. The present request is to add this CA certificate and enable it for EV.

authority.name: Go Daddy
authority.summary: Go Daddy operates a commercial CA based in the US and serving customers worldwide. Go Daddy has three root CA certs already included in Mozilla, all of which it would like upgraded for EV use.

certificate.name: Valicert Class 2 Policy Validation Authority
certificate.summary: Root CA certificate with a single subordinate CA issuing SSL certificates (DV, OV and EV), email certificates, and code signing certificates.
certificate.document: Starfield Technologies, Inc. Certificate Policy and Certification Practice Statement (CP/CPS)
certificate.comments: Note that this root CA certificate is already included in the Mozilla list. The present request is to enable this CA certificate for EV. Both of the CA certificates below are cross-signed to the Valicert Class 2 Policy Validation Authority root for legacy support, so this root should be configured to enable EV with both of the EV OIDs associated with the other certificates.

certificate.name: Go Daddy Class 2 CA
certificate.summary: Root CA certificate with a single subordinate CA issuing SSL certificates (DV, OV and EV), email certificates, and code signing certificates.
certificate.document: Starfield Technologies, Inc. Certificate Policy and Certification Practice Statement (CP/CPS)
certificate.comments: Note that this root CA certificate is already included in the Mozilla list. The present request is to enable this CA certificate for EV.

certificate.name: Starfield Class 2 CA
certificate.summary: Root CA certificate with a single subordinate CA issuing SSL certificates (DV, OV and EV), email certificates, and code signing certificates.
certificate.document: Starfield Technologies, Inc. Certificate Policy and Certification Practice Statement (CP/CPS)
certificate.comments: Note that this root CA certificate is already included in the Mozilla list. The present request is to enable this CA certificate for EV.

authority.name: GlobalSign
authority.summary: GlobalSign is a commercial CA based in Portsmouth NH and serving customers worldwide. It currently has two root CA certificates preloaded in Mozilla. The first root has two subordinate CAs (for domain-validated and organizationally-validated certificates respectively) and the second root has one subordinate CA (for extended validation certificates). (There is also a valid chain from the EV subordinate to the first root via a cross-signing certificate.)

certificate.name: GlobalSign Root CA
certificate.summary: Root CA with two subordinate CAs issuing SSL certificates (DV and OV), email, and code signing certificates.
certificate.comments: Note that a version of this root CA certificate with the same public key but an earlier expiration date (2014-01-28) is already included in the Mozilla list. The present request is to replace the older certificate with this certificate and then enable this CA certificate for EV.

certificate.name: GlobalSign Root CA - R2
certificate.summary: Root CA with one subordinate CA issuing SSL certificates (EV), email, and code signing certificates.
certificate.comments: Note that this root CA certificate is already included in the Mozilla list. The present request is to enable this CA certificate for EV.

authority.name: Cisco
authority.summary: Cisco is a leading provider of networking equipment to consumers and businesses worldwide.

certificate.name: Cisco Root CA 2048
certificate.summary: This is an off-line root CA that issues CA certificates to one or more Cisco-controlled subordinate CAs (including the Cisco Manufacturing Sub-CA). The subordinate CAs in turn issue end entity certificates, e.g., for use in Cisco network equipment with embedded web servers and web-based administrative interfaces.
certificate.document: Cisco Root CA 2048 Certification Practice Statement, Version 1.1
Cisco Root CA 2048 Certificate Policy, Version 1.0

authority.name: thawte
authority.summary: thawte is a commercial CA with worldwide operations and customer base; it is a subsidiary of VeriSign, Inc.

certificate.name: thawte Primary Root CA
certificate.summary: This CA issues a CA certificate to the subordinate CAs thawte Extended Validation SSL CA and thawte Extended Validation SSL SGC CA, which in turn issue Extended Validation certificates for SSL-enabled servers.
certificate.comments: Note that for compatibility reasons thawte has implemented a cross-signing scheme involving this CA. In this scheme, if applications not supporting EV functionality (e.g., Firefox 2 and earlier) encounter thawte EV certificates then they will end up treating this CA as a subordinate CA under the existing Thawte Premium Server CA root.

authority.name: GeoTrust
authority.summary: GeoTrust is a commercial CA with worldwide operations and customer base; it is a subsidiary of VeriSign, Inc.

certificate.name: GeoTrust Primary Certification Authority
certificate.summary: This CA issues a CA certificate to the subordinate CA GeoTrust Extended Validation SSL CA, which in turn issues Extended Validation certificates for SSL-enabled servers.
certificate.comments: Note that for compatibility reasons GeoTrust has implemented a cross-signing scheme involving this CA. In this scheme, if applications not supporting EV functionality (e.g., Firefox 2 and earlier) encounter GeoTrust EV certificates then they will end up treating this CA as a subordinate CA under the existing Equifax Secure CA root.

authority.name: Network Solutions
authority.summary: Network Solutions is a US-based commercial CA with worldwide customer base.

audit.document: Report in relation to the WebTrust for Certification Authorities Extended Validation Criteria

certificate.name: Network Solutions Certificate Authority
certificate.summary: This CA directly issues non-EV certificates for SSL-enabled servers (SiteSafe Basic, Pro, and Wildcard). The CA also has a subordinate CA, Network Solutions EV SSL CA, which issues Extended Validation certificates for SSL-enabled servers. There are no other subordinate CAs under this root.
certificate.document: Network Solutions Certification Practice Statement, Version 1.4.1
Certification Practice Statement (CPS) for Extended Validation (EV) Certification, Version 1.1
